Description: Limestone stela: a tall, narrow stela, roughly cut from limestone, with a rounded top and an inscription in low relief on the upper part of the front surface. The text gives the name Hedjrekhyt without any determinative. Good condition.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tomb of Djet, subsidiary grave
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' I, 27; pls. XXXI, 3; XXXIII, 3; LXI (lower left); P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit I (Wiesbaden, 1963), 179,599.
